Renaissance_Ravensly,"2016-08-09T14:52:58.12Z","Battle of the Cars","

I guess you haven'
column2: t heard from me in a while, so I decided to fill you in with yet another review. &nbsp
column4: ll review the marvel Superheroes: Mighty Micros: Spiderman v.s Green Goblin. Let&#39

column1: Box/Instructions: The box shows the two cars racing, with the pilots inside trying to duel each other. Instructions were really easy to follow.

column2: t many rare or unique parts to the set. The most striking parts to me are the pumpkin minifigure head and Green Goblin&#39

column1: <h3>Minifigures: The minifigures are some of the best reasons to get this set. You get Spiderman with short legs, the same old torso and a new head showing a more quirky expression. &nbsp
column2: You also get Green goblin with short legs, a unique torso, a head showing a sneer and his unique hat piece. Spiderman also comes with a camera and Green Goblin comes with a pumpkin minifigure head.&nbsp

column1: The build: The build was very easy, involving no stickers and very few technic parts. To me, the most challenging part of the build was assembling the wheels. If you are an experienced builder, this will only take a couple of minutes.

column2: The completed model looks like a helicopter and Green Goblin&#39
column3: s flying machine. There are a few play features. The first is you can spin the rotor on Spiderman&#39
column4: s helicopter. You can also fire flick fire missiles at Green Goblin&#39
column5: s craft. The wheels can move on each craft. &nbsp
column7: s craft, you can move the wings up and down.&nbsp

column2: If you are looking for a display piece, this will work. however, I think that children will have a better time with this, having a few play features to activate. However, this is a very cheap set, so I highly recommend it to you, as it won&#39
column3: t take too much of your wallet or allowance.&nbsp

Mighty Micros...you either love them or think they are lame.

column3: Many people are turned off by the short legs and cartoonish features, but I think they are OK.&nbsp

column6: He comes with a camera and a &quot
column9: Green Goblin is very cartoony and holds one of his pumpkin bombs.&nbsp

column2: I love Spiderman and was eager to add this to my collection, but there is just something disappointing about this set.
column3: It is definitely one of the weaker ones in the first Mighty Micro line.&nbsp
column4: However, I do look forward to the new ones coming out.&nbsp
column5: I think Lego learned from these and got a little more clever in their builds for the new line.
